resources.string: Transect data has been marked for background upload. You will receive a notification when upload is complete.
% of ground covered by plants, litter, or rock.\n\n(# points of any cover type/total # points)
% of ground not covered by plants, litter and rock.\n\n(# points bare ground/total # points)
% cover of all plant elements combined.\n\n(# points with any plant/total # points)
% cover of each specific plant type.\n\n(# points with plant type/total # points)

Land Info must be configured with a user account.

coordinated by:\n The Jornada,\n New Mexico State University
Sync with server only when on wifi

Plot List Help

This screen displays a selectable list of your plots.

New plots are added via the Land Info app, transparently started when you click the \"+\" icon.

While you can enter transect data for incomplete plots, plots must be completed and uploaded by Land Info before transect data can be uploaded.

Clicking a plot name will take you to the Plot Detail screen to allow entering new or viewing past transect data.

Checkmarks indicate whether a plot has ever had transects uploaded.

Plot Detail Help

This screen allows you to enter transect data for an individual plot and to select past transect data for review.

The Plot Data button in the center of the screen will start the Land Info app for entering and/or review of plot data.

The four buttons surrounding the Plot Data button allow you to enter current transect data for each corresponding cardinal direction.

When each transect is complete, a checkmark will appear on its corresponding button.

When all transects are complete, the Submit button will activate, allowing you to upload current data to the server.

Once data is submitted, the Submit button will deactivate and display a green checkmark, indicating that the current data has been submitted. A message will display in the upper left corner of the screen with pending/upload staus of the current data.

Transect data can only be entered once in a 24 hour period.

Past transect data can be viewed via the \"View previously submitted data\" dropdown at the bottom of the screen. The dropdown presents a list of previous dates. Selecting one will load this screen with that date\'s data.

When viewing previous data, a Summary button is available that will take you to a Summary screen. You can also view individual transect data via the cardinal direction buttons.

Transect Help

This screen contains a selectable list of transect segments.

Clicking a segment name will take you to the Segment data entry screens, beginning with the Cover screen.

When data entry is complete for a given segement, that segment\'s list item will display a checkmark.

Cover Help

This screen allows you to enter cover types for each sample point along the measuring stick.

At the top is a representation of the measuring stick.

In a column below each sample point are buttons for the various cover types.

At least one cover type must be selected for each sample point.

The first button in each column is for bare ground. This button is mutually exclusive of all the others. Selecting it disables the other buttons in the column.

If bare ground is not selected, you can select one or more of the rest of the cover types.

When a selection has been made in each column, a checkmark is displayed on the Cover tab at the top of the screen.

Swiping right-to-left will take you to the other Segment data screen: Height/Gap/Species.

Height/Gap/Species Help

This screen allows you to enter canopy height, plant gap, and species data for the segment.

The left section contains buttons for canopy height. Use your measuring stick to estimate height.

The center section contains buttons for basal and canopy gaps. Lay your measuring stick on the ground, and select the basal/canopy gap buttons that best match the flora configuration around it.

The right section contains fields for entering observed species and species counts.

Summary Help

This screen contains a summary of the plot\'s transect data for this date. Definitions of key summary statistics presented below.

Total cover: % of ground covered by plants, litter, or rock. (# points of any cover type/total # points)

Bare ground: % of ground not covered by plants, litter and rock. (# points bare ground/total # points)

Foliar cover: % cover of all plant elements combined. (# points with any plant/total # points)

Plant cover: % cover of each specific plant type. (# points with plant type/total # points)

Canopy height: % of plants in each height class. (# points with height class/total # points)

Gaps: % of ground occurring in large gaps (>1m) between plant bases and between plant canopies. (# points with canopy gap/ total # points, # points plant basal gaps /total # points)

Species density: The number of each individual plant species per plot (calculated per m\u00B2). (# individual plants observed of the species of interest/area sampled)
